articles.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's Akasa Air Opens Bookings For Flights Starting Aug 7
articles.description: The Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air will launch its first commercial flight on August 7 by operating its first service on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route using a Boeing 737 Max plane.
articles.content:
The airline carrier said flight operations will be conducted on two Boeing 737 Max aircraft.

articles.title: Supreme Court Allows Unmarried Woman To End Pregnancy At 24 Weeks
articles.description: In a significant order, the Supreme Court Thursday expanded the scope of the Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act to include "unmarried woman" and allowed a woman to abort her 24-weeks pregnancy arising out of a consensual relationship.
articles.content:
Supreme Court expanded scope of Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act to include "unmarried woman".

articles.title: Droupadi Murmu Is India's New President
articles.description: India got its first tribal President yesterday as NDA choice Droupadi Murmu scooped up over 60 per cent of the total vote value. Opposition's Yashwant Sinha conceded defeat after three rounds of counting. The President-elect will take oath on July 25
articles.content: <li>Droupadi Murmu got 64.03 per cent of total vote value after three rounds of counting. Yashwant Sinha ended up with 35.97 per cent. Ms Murmu received 2,824 votes with a value of 6,76,803. Mr Sinha… [+2861 chars]

articles.title: Sri Lanka Security Forces Raid Main Protest Camp As New President Takes Over
articles.description: Hundreds of Sri Lankan soldiers and police raided the main anti-government protest camp in the country's capital early Friday and began tearing down tents of unarmed activists, an AFP reporter said.
articles.content:
